original: Upon the termination of this Agreement, or upon Company’s earlier request, Consultant will deliver to Company all Confidential Information and Company’s property relating thereto and all tangible embodiments thereof, in Consultant’s possession or control.
ollama_generated: Upon the expiration or early termination of this Agreement, at Company's sole discretion, Consultant shall promptly return to the Company all Confidential Information, Company property related thereto, and any tangible embodiments thereof that are within Consultant's possession or control. The Company shall not be obligated to verify whether Consultant has complied with this provision after the termination of this Agreement.

original: 4. Reports . Consultant agrees, from time to time during the term of this Agreement, to keep Company advised as to Consultant’s progress in performing the Services and, as reasonably requested by Company, prepare written reports with respect thereto. It is understood that the time required in the preparation of such written reports shall be considered time devoted to the performance of the Services by Consultant. All such reports prepared by Consultant shall be the sole property of Company.
ollama_generated:
4. Updates and Reports: The Consultant acknowledges their responsibility, throughout the Agreement's duration, to regularly update the Company on their progress related to the Services. Upon reasonable request from the Company, the Consultant will prepare written updates in a timely manner. It is noted that the time spent on the preparation of these updates shall be considered as part of the total hours devoted to the Services by the Consultant. All such updates and reports compiled by the Consultant become the exclusive property of the Company.

In this revised clause, the consultant's obligation has been weakened slightly by replacing "keep advised" with "regularly update," and "prepare written reports" with "compile updates." Additionally, the phrase "all such reports prepared by Consultant shall be the sole property of Company" has been replaced with "All such updates and reports compiled by the Consultant become the exclusive property of the Company," implying that the consultant may have more discretion in the format or content of their communications.

original: 7. No Debarment . Consultant represents and warrants that Consultant has not been debarred under Section (a) or (b) of 21 U.S.C. Section 335a and does not appear on the United States Food and Drug debarment list. Consultant represents and warrants that Consultant has not committed any crime or conduct that could result in such debarment or Consultant’s exclusion from any governmental healthcare program. Consultant represents and warrants that, to Consultant’s knowledge, no investigations, claims or proceedings with respect to any such crimes or conduct are pending or threatened against Consultant. Consultant agrees and undertakes to promptly notify the Company if Consultant becomes debarred or proceedings have been initiated against Consultant with respect to debarment, whether such debarment or initiation of proceedings occurs during or after the term of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 7. Permitted Debarment . The Consultant affirms that they are not currently, nor have ever been, debarred under Sections (a) or (b) of 21 U.S.C. Section 335a, and their name does not appear on the United States Food and Drug Administration's debarment list. The Consultant affirms that they have not engaged in any criminal activity or conduct that could lead to such debarment or exclusion from a governmental healthcare program. The Consultant affirms that, to the best of their knowledge, no investigations, claims, or proceedings concerning such crimes or conduct are currently pending against them, nor are there any imminent threats of such actions. In the event that the Consultant becomes aware of any investigation, claim, or proceeding related to debarment, whether initiated during or after the term of this Agreement, they agree to promptly disclose this information to the Company.

original: 11. Background Check and Authorization to Work . This offer of employment is contingent on the Company’s completion of a satisfactory background check of you. Please note that because of employer regulations adopted in the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, within three (3) business days of starting your new position you will need to present documentation demonstrating that you have authorization to work in the United States. If you have questions about this requirement, which applies to U.S. citizens and non-U.S.  citizens alike, please let us know.
ollama_generated: 11. Background Check and Authorization to Work: Your employment with our company is subject to the successful completion of a comprehensive background check by us, a process that we will initiate upon accepting your offer. It is important to note that, in accordance with regulations under the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, you are responsible for providing proof of your authorization to work in the United States within three (3) business days of your commencement of employment. We will provide guidance should you have any questions regarding this requirement, which applies equally to both U.S. citizens and non-U.S. citizens.

ollama_generated:
[Signed Page to be Inserted Later] 844.KEY.CURE | www.kiromic.com PAGE 5 This Agreement is hereby executed by the Parties on the Effective Date, with the understanding that any potential non-compliance or breach of obligations will not automatically terminate this Agreement but shall be addressed in good faith through a mutually agreed resolution process.

The shift in this clause weakens the obligation to immediately terminate the agreement upon a breach or non-compliance, instead introducing a more flexible and cooperative approach for resolving issues that may arise during its tenure.

KIROMIC, INC - CONSULTANT AGREEMENT:

KIROMIC, INC (the "Company") hereby engages the Consultant identified in Schedule A ("Consultant") to provide consulting services for the Company. The parties agree as follows:

1. Scope of Services: The Consultant shall provide consulting services to the Company as described in Schedule B (the "Services"). The Consultant shall perform the Services with the skill, care, and diligence usually exercised by consultants in the same or similar circumstances. However, the Consultant's performance under this Agreement does not guarantee any specific results for the Company.

2. Term: This agreement shall commence on the date first set forth above (the "Effective Date") and continue through the term as described in Schedule C (the "Term"), unless earlier terminated as provided herein.

3. Compensation: The Company agrees to pay the Consultant the compensation as described in Schedule D (the "Compensation"). The Company shall pay the Compensation only upon satisfactory completion of the Services and receipt by the Company of an invoice from the Consultant.

4. Confidentiality: The Consultant acknowledges that during the performance of the Services, it may have access to certain confidential or proprietary information belonging to the Company (the "Confidential Information"). The Consultant agrees not to disclose any Confidential Information to third parties without the prior written consent of the Company and shall use reasonable efforts to safeguard the secrecy of all such Confidential Information.

5. Termination: Either party may terminate this Agreement upon providing thirty (30) days' written notice to the other party. Upon termination, the Consultant shall promptly deliver to the Company all documents and materials containing or relating to the Confidential Information.

6. Indemnification: The Consultant agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Company, its officers, directors, and employees from any claims, damages, liabilities, losses, or expenses (including attorneys' fees) arising out of or in connection with the Consultant's acts or omissions under this Agreement.

7. Entire Agreement: This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties regarding the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, representations, and understandings, whether written or oral. Any amendments or modifications to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both parties.

8. Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of [State], without regard to its conflict of law principles.

9. Dispute Resolution: Any disputes arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration, conducted by JAMS, in accordance with its Comprehensive Arbitration Rules and Procedures. The seat of the arbitration shall be [City], [State].

10. Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original and all of which together shall constitute one instrument. Facsimile, electronic, or scanned signatures shall be deemed to be original signatures for all purposes.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first set forth above.

original: • Provide business and statistical analysis of company metrics • Provide leadership role for business development strategies • Manage all in house consulting duties to maximize return for company objectives • Manage key marketing and communication campaigns • Prioritize and support clinical product pipeline business priorities • Work closely with executive team to ensure department initiatives are all aligned • Locate, evaluate and develop new business contacts and opportunities 2. Compensation . The Company will compensate Consultant at the rate of $400 per hour (19 hours cap monthly; anything over these hrs must be preapproved by management), payable in accordance with the Company’s standard payroll schedule, and subject to withholding as legally required. This compensation will be subject to adjustment pursuant to the Company’s consultant compensation policies in effect from time to time. Consultants shall be given written notice of any adjustments to compensation at least fourteen (14) days prior to adjustments becoming effective.
ollama_generated:
1. Responsibilities:
   - Analyze and present business and statistical data pertaining to company metrics
   - Collaborate on the strategic direction for business development, assuming a leadership role
   - Oversee all in-house consulting tasks with the aim of optimizing returns for company goals
   - Plan, execute, and monitor key marketing and communication campaigns
   - Coordinate departmental efforts to prioritize and support clinical product pipeline priorities
   - Collaborate extensively with the executive team to ensure alignment of department initiatives
   - Identify, assess, and capitalize on potential new business contacts and opportunities

2. Compensation:
   The Company will remunerate the Consultant at a rate of $400 per hour, subject to a cap of 19 hours monthly; any additional hours worked must be pre-approved by management. Payment will be made in accordance with the Company's standard payroll schedule and may be subject to required withholding. The compensation package is susceptible to modification according to the Company's consultant compensation policies as they evolve over time. Consultants will receive written notification of any changes to their compensation, with such notices provided at least fourteen (14) days prior to the effective date of the adjustment. However, it should be noted that the Company reserves the right to initiate these adjustments without advance notice in exceptional circumstances.

844.KEY.CURE | www.kiromic.com PAGE 7

Modification of Obligation:

Upon receipt of written notice from the other party detailing any breach or default under this Agreement, the non-breaching party shall have a reasonable time to remedy such breach or default, provided that the extent and nature of the remedial action required may be adjusted by mutual agreement between the parties. If the breaching party fails to comply with the remediation plan agreed upon within the stipulated timeframe, this Agreement shall not automatically terminate but shall continue in force, and the non-breaching party may then seek any available remedy at law or equity for the continuing breach or default.
